meanings.definition: To restrain or prevent (someone or something) from acting or progressing
meanings.sent1: Loud noises can inhibit concentration during a test.
meanings.sent2: Fear can inhibit someone from trying new things.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel inhibits the bird from reaching the feeder.
meanings.sent4: Doubt inhibits the mind like a heavy chain.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog inhibits visibility on the road.

meanings.definition: To suppress or hold back (an urge or impulse)
meanings.sent1: Taking deep breaths can help inhibit the urge to panic.
meanings.sent2: She tried to inhibit her laughter during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent3: The delicious smell of cookies inhibits my diet plans.
meanings.sent4: His calm demeanor inhibits the anger boiling inside him.
meanings.sent5: The strong willpower inhibits the temptation to eat the entire cake.

meanings.definition: To hinder or limit the growth or development of (something)
meanings.sent1: The lack of sunlight can inhibit plant growth.
meanings.sent2: Poor funding can inhibit the progress of a research project.
meanings.sent3: The slow internet inhibits the completion of online tasks.
meanings.sent4: Negative thoughts can inhibit personal growth and success.
meanings.sent5: The strict rules inhibit creativity in the classroom.
